messages.subject: Re: My son wants PSP info
messages.msgSnippet: My 14 year old could help him.  That s the new hand held play station right??  He knows how to put movies on a memory stick(?) and has some links.  Email me
messages.messageBody:
My 14 year old could help him. That's the new hand held play
station right?? He knows how to put movies on a memory stick(?) and
has some links. Email me offline and we could exchange numbers too
if that would help. We have a cell phone with free long distance so
he could call you. He is asleep right now and is mowing the
neighbors lawn when he wakes up. He'd be thrilled to talk to
someone about the psp.

Here's a link in my favorite places:
http://hroo772.hopto.org:8181/psp-launchers/

Barb in VA

--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Gwen McCrea"
<gwendolin00@h...> wrote:
> Gabriel (8) wants to figure out how to connect to the web and
download
> free games for his PlayStation Portable. I've looked at several
> websites, but to be honest I am just in way over my head! I don't
know
> if the "homebrew" games are okay to download, or how to go about
it.
> Do any of you, or your kids, have suggestions for how I can help
> Gabriel figure this out?
>
> Thanks,
>
> Gwen

messages.subject: My son wants PSP info
messages.msgSnippet: Gabriel (8) wants to figure out how to connect to the web and download free games for his PlayStation Portable. I ve looked at several websites, but to be
messages.messageBody:
Gabriel (8) wants to figure out how to connect to the web and download
free games for his PlayStation Portable. I've looked at several
websites, but to be honest I am just in way over my head! I don't know
if the "homebrew" games are okay to download, or how to go about it.
Do any of you, or your kids, have suggestions for how I can help
Gabriel figure this out?

Thanks,

Gwen
